At One Nexuz, our expert business consultants do all the heavy lifting so that you can tap into the UAE’s exciting tax benefits, 100% foreign ownership, and total freedom to repatriate profits. Join the 70,000+ businesses thriving in Dubai and take advantage of its world-class infrastructure, seamless banking, and global market access.

leftSection_5.title: Launch Confidently with Our 4-Step Company Registration Process

items.title: Book a Business Consultation
items.description: We'll start with a one-on-one session to assess your business goals and activities and create a tailored registration plan.

items.title: Prepare & Submit Documents

items.title: Issue a Trade License

items.title: Create Your Bank Account
items.description: Finally, our specialists assist you in identifying the ideal local or international bank and opening a personal or corporate account

faq.title: Clear Answers, Expert Insights, Hassle Free Consulting Experience

items.question: Can I set up a company remotely?
items.answer: Yes, most business registrations can be done remotely, including e-signatures, digital submissions, and POA setups.

items.question: Is Dubai a good place to register my business?
items.answer: Yes, Dubai’s thriving economy, global market, and extensive range of commercial benefits make it a fantastic location for startups, entrepreneurs, and global brands.

items.question: What documents do I need to register my company in the UAE?
items.answer: You’ll need copies of your passport, proof of address, description of business activities, and several other business documents, depending on your desired license.

items.question: How long does business registration in Dubai take?
items.answer: Company registration in the UAE can take 1-2 weeks, depending on your business activities, location, and unique needs. You can get registered in a shorter time in Dubai’s free zones.

items.question: Can expats register their company in the UAE?
items.answer: Yes, foreigners can register and launch their business in either designated Free Zones or on the Mainland with a local sponsor, agent, or nominee.
